children.name: zoomEnd
Example - bind to the map zoomEnd event after initialization
Example - bind to the map zoomEnd event on initialization

children.description: Fired when the map zoom level has changed.

children.name: zoomStart
Example - bind to the map zoomStart event after initialization
Example - bind to the map zoomStart event on initialization

children.description: Fired when the map zoom level is about to change.Cancelling the event will prevent the user action.

children.name: shapeMouseLeave
Example - bind to the map shapeMouseLeave event after initialization
Example - bind to the map shapeMouseLeave event on initialization

children.description: Fired when the mouse leaves a shape.

children.name: shapeMouseEnter
Example - bind to the map shapeMouseEnter event after initialization
Example - bind to the map shapeMouseEnter event on initialization

children.description: Fired when the mouse enters a shape.

children.name: shapeCreated
Example - bind to the map shapeCreated event after initialization
Example - bind to the map shapeCreated event on initialization

children.description: Fired when a shape is created, but is not rendered yet.

children.name: shapeClick
Example - bind to the map shapeClick event after initialization
Example - bind to the map shapeClick event on initialization

children.description: Fired when a shape is clicked or tapped.

children.name: reset
Example - bind to the map reset event after initialization
Example - bind to the map reset event on initialization

children.description: Fired when the map is reset.This typically occurs on initial load and after a zoom/center change.

children.name: panEnd
Example - bind to the map panEnd event after initialization
Example - bind to the map panEnd event on initialization

children.description: Fires after the map viewport has been moved.

children.name: pan
Example - bind to the map pan event after initialization
Example - bind to the map pan event on initialization

children.description: Fired while the map viewport is being moved.

children.name: markerClick
children.description: Fired when a marker has been clicked or tapped.

children.name: markerCreated
Example - Draw a shape (circle) instead of a marker

children.description: Fired when a marker has been created and is about to be displayed.Cancelling the event will prevent the marker from being shown.Use [markerActivate](#events-markerActivate) if you need to access the marker DOM element.> Markers are automatically created for GeoJSON Point geometries. If the markerCreated event is cancelled a regular shape (circle) will be created instead.

children.name: markerActivate
Example - Customize the marker DOM element

children.description: Fired when a marker has been displayed and has a DOM element assigned.

children.name: click
Example - subscribe to the click event after initialization
Example - place marker on clicked location

children.description: Fired when the user clicks on the map.

children.name: beforeReset
children.description: Fired immediately before the map is reset.This event is typically used for cleanup by layer implementers.

children.name: zoom

parameters.name: level `Number`
parameters.description: The new zoom level. The value is clamped to the [[minZoom](#configuration-minZoom), [maxZoom](#configuration-maxZoom)] interval.

children.description: Gets or sets the map zoom level.The setter is chainable, i.e. returns the map instance.

children.name: viewToLocation
Example - retrieve location corresponding to view center (kendo.geometry.Point)
Example - retrieve location corresponding to view center (Array)

parameters.name: zoom `Number`
parameters.description: Optional. Assumed zoom level. Defaults to the current zoom level.

parameters.name: point `Array|kendo.geometry.Point`
parameters.description: The view coordinates.An array argument is assumed to be in x, y order.

children.description: Returns the geographical location that correspond to the view (relative) coordinates.

children.name: viewSize
children.description: Retrieves the size of the visible portion of the map.

children.name: setOptions
Example - set map zoom & center simultaneously

parameters.name: options `Object`
parameters.description: The new options to be applied.

children.description: Resets the map and applies new options over the current state.

children.name: resize

parameters.name: force `Boolean` *optional*
parameters.description: Defines whether the widget should proceed with resizing even if the element dimensions have not changed.

children.description: Adjusts the widget layout to match the size of the container.

children.name: locationToView
Retrieves the view coordinates of the map center (kendo.dataviz.map.Location)
Retrieves the view coordinates of the map center (Array)

parameters.name: location `Array|kendo.dataviz.map.Location`
parameters.description: The geographic location.An array argument is assumed to be in [Latitude, Lonigude] order.

children.description: Returns the view (relative) coordinates that correspond to a geographical location.

children.name: locationToLayer
Example - retrieve the projected coordinates of a location (kendo.dataviz.map.Location)
Example - retrieve the projected coordinates of a location (Array)

parameters.name: zoom `Number`
parameters.description: Optional. Assumed zoom level. Defaults to the current zoom level.

parameters.name: location `Array|kendo.dataviz.map.Location`
parameters.description: The geographic location.An array argument is assumed to be in [Latitude, Lonigude] order.

children.description: Returns the layer (projected) coordinates that correspond to a geographical location.

children.name: layerToLocation
Example - retrieve location of NW corner (kendo.geometry.Point)
Example - retrieve location of NW corner (Array)

parameters.name: zoom `Number`
parameters.description: Optional. Assumed zoom level. Defaults to the current zoom level.

parameters.name: point `Array|kendo.geometry.Point`
parameters.description: The layer (projected) coordinates.An array argument is assumed to be in x, y order.

children.description: Transforms layer (projected) coordinates to geographical location.

children.name: extent
Example - set the map extent to show Australia

parameters.name: extent `kendo.dataviz.map.Extent`
parameters.description: The new extent of the map.

children.description: Gets or sets the [map extent](/api/dataviz/map/extent) or visible area.The setter is chainable, i.e. returns the map instance.

children.name: eventToView
Example - position elements over map on click

parameters.name: e `Object|jQuery.Event`
parameters.description: The DOM or jQuery mouse event.

children.description: Retrieves relative (view) coordinates that correspond to this mouse event.Layer elements positioned on these coordinates will appear under the mouse cursor.View coordinates are no longer valid after a map [reset](#events-reset).

children.name: eventToLocation
Example - place marker on clicked location

parameters.name: e `Object|jQuery.Event`
parameters.description: The DOM or jQuery mouse event.

children.description: Retrieves the geographic location that correspond to this mouse event.

children.name: eventToLayer

parameters.name: e `Object|jQuery.Event`
parameters.description: The DOM or jQuery mouse event.

children.description: Retrieves projected (layer) coordinates that correspond to this mouse event.Layer coordinates are absolute and change only when the zoom level is changed.

children.name: eventOffset
Example - position elements over widget on click

parameters.name: e `Object|jQuery.Event`
parameters.description: The DOM or jQuery mouse event.

children.description: Returns the event coordinates relative to the map element.Offset coordinates are not synchronized to a particular location on the map.

children.name: destroy
Example - destroy the map and remove it from the DOM

children.description: Prepares the widget for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> This method does not remove the widget element from DOM.

children.name: center
Example - set the map center and zoom level

parameters.name: center `Array|kendo.dataviz.map.Location`
parameters.description: The location of the new map center.An array argument is assumed to be in [Latitude, Lonigude] order.

children.description: Gets or sets the map center.The setter is chainable, i.e. returns the map instance.

children.name: zoomable
children.description: Controls whether the map zoom level can be changed by the user.

children.name: zoom
children.description: The initial zoom level.Typical web maps use zoom levels from 0 (whole world) to 19 (sub-meter features).The map size is derived from the zoom level and minScale options: `size = (2 ^ zoom) * minSize`

children.name: wraparound
children.description: Specifies whether the map should wrap around the east-west edges.

children.name: pannable
children.description: Controls whether the user can pan the map.

children.name: minSize
children.description: The size of the map in pixels at zoom level 0.

children.name: maxZoom
Example - limit zoom in to level 10

children.description: The maximum zoom level.Typical web maps use zoom levels from 0 (whole world) to 19 (sub-meter features).> The map [zoom](#configuration-zoom) is clamped to the [minZoom, maxZoom] interval.

children.name: minZoom
Example - limit zoom out to level 3

children.description: The minimum zoom level.Typical web maps use zoom levels from 0 (whole world) to 19 (sub-meter features).> The map [zoom](#configuration-zoom) is clamped to the [minZoom, maxZoom] interval.

children.name: markers.tooltip.showOn
Example - show tooltip on mouse enter

children.description: The event on which the tooltip will be shown. Predefined values are "mouseenter", "click" and "focus".

children.name: markers.tooltip.showAfter
children.description: Specify the delay in milliseconds before the tooltip is shown. This option is ignored if showOn is set to "click" or "focus".

children.name: markers.tooltip.position
children.description: The position relative to the target element, at which the tooltip will be shown. Predefined values are "bottom", "top", "left", "right", "center".

children.name: markers.tooltip.width
Example - set the width of the tooltip

children.description: The width (in pixels) of the tooltip.

children.name: markers.tooltip.height
Example - set the height of the tooltip

children.description: The height (in pixels) of the tooltip.

children.name: markers.tooltip.iframe
Example - load content from remote URL

children.description: Explicitly states whether content iframe should be created.

children.name: markers.tooltip.callout
children.description: Specifies if the tooltip callout will be displayed.

children.name: markers.tooltip.template
children.description: The [template](/api/framework/kendo#methods-template) which renders the tooltip content.The fields which can be used in the template are:* location - the marker location (`kendo.dataviz.map.Location` instance)* marker - the marker instance> Setting a template disables the content option.

children.name: markers.tooltip.content.url
Example - load content from remote URL

children.description: Specifies a URL or request options that the tooltip should load its content from.>Note: For URLs starting with a protocol (e.g. http://),a container iframe element is automatically created. This behavior may change in futureversions, so it is advisable to always use the [iframe configuration option](#iframe).

children.name: markers.tooltip.content
Example - extract the content from target marker

children.description: The text or a function which result will be shown within the tooltip.By default the tooltip will display the target element title attribute content.

children.name: markers.tooltip.animation.open.duration
children.description: Defines the animation duration.

children.name: markers.tooltip.animation.open.effects
children.description: Effect to be used for opening of the Tooltip.

children.name: markers.tooltip.animation.open
children.description: The animation that will be used when a Tooltip opens.

children.name: markers.tooltip.animation.close.duration
children.description: Defines the animation duration.

children.name: markers.tooltip.animation.close.effects
children.description: Effect to be used for closing of the tooltip.

children.name: markers.tooltip.animation.close
children.description: The animation that will be used when a Tooltip closes.

children.name: markers.tooltip.animation
children.description: A collection of {Animation} objects, used to change default animations. A value of **false**will disable all animations in the widget.

children.name: markers.tooltip.autoHide
Example - hide tooltip on mouse leave

children.description: Specifies if the tooltip will be hidden when mouse leaves the target element. If set to false a close button will be shown within tooltip. If set to false, showAfter is specified and the showOn is set to "mouseenter" the Tooltip will be displayed after the given timeout even if the element is no longer hovered.

children.name: markers.tooltip
children.description: Kendo UI Tooltip options for this marker.

children.name: markers.title
children.description: The marker title. Displayed as browser tooltip.

children.name: markers.shape
children.description: The marker shape. The following pre-defined marker shapes are available:* pinTarget* pinMarker shapes are implemented as CSS classes on the marker element (span.k-marker).For example "pinTarget" is rendered as "k-marker-pin-target".

children.name: markers.location
children.description: The marker location on the map. Coordinates are listed as `[Latitude, Longitude]`.

children.name: markers
Example - setting default shape for all markers

children.description: Static markers to display on the map.

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip.showOn
Example - show tooltip on mouse enter

children.description: The event on which the tooltip will be shown. Predefined values are "mouseenter", "click" and "focus".

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip.showAfter
children.description: Specify the delay in milliseconds before the tooltip is shown. This option is ignored if showOn is set to "click" or "focus".

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip.position
children.description: The position relative to the target element, at which the tooltip will be shown. Predefined values are "bottom", "top", "left", "right", "center".

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip.width
Example - set the width of the tooltip

children.description: The width (in pixels) of the tooltip.

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip.height
Example - set the height of the tooltip

children.description: The height (in pixels) of the tooltip.

children.description: Explicitly states whether content iframe should be created.

children.description: The [template](/api/framework/kendo#methods-template) which renders the tooltip content.The fields which can be used in the template are:* location - the marker location (`kendo.dataviz.map.Location` instance)* marker - the marker instance> Setting a template disables the content option.

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip.content.url
Example - load content from remote URL

children.description: Specifies a URL or request options that the tooltip should load its content from.>Note: For URLs starting with a protocol (e.g. http://),a container iframe element is automatically created. This behavior may change in futureversions, so it is advisable to always use the [iframe configuration option](#iframe).

Example - extract the content from target marker

children.description: The text or a function which result will be shown within the tooltip.By default the tooltip will display the target element title attribute content.

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip.animation.open.duration
children.description: Defines the animation duration.

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip.animation.open.effects
children.description: Effect to be used for opening of the Tooltip.

children.description: The animation that will be used when a Tooltip opens.

children.description: Defines the animation duration.

children.description: Effect to be used for closing of the tooltip.

children.description: The animation that will be used when a Tooltip closes.

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip.animation
children.description: A collection of {Animation} objects, used to change default animations. A value of **false**will disable all animations in the widget.

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip.autoHide
Example - hide tooltip on mouse leave

children.description: Specifies if the tooltip will be hidden when mouse leaves the target element. If set to false a close button will be shown within tooltip. If set to false, showAfter is specified and the showOn is set to "mouseenter" the Tooltip will be displayed after the given timeout even if the element is no longer hovered.

children.name: markerDefaults.tooltip
children.description: Default Kendo UI Tooltip options for this marker.

children.name: markerDefaults.shape
Example - setting default shape for all markers

children.description: The default marker shape. The following pre-defined marker shapes are available:* pinTarget* pinMarker shapes are implemented as CSS classes on the marker element (span.k-marker).For example "pinTarget" is rendered as "k-marker-pin-target".

children.name: markerDefaults
Example - setting default shape for all markers

children.description: The default options for all markers.

children.name: layers.zIndex
children.description: The zIndex for this layer.Layers are normally stacked in declaration order (last one is on top).

children.name: layers.valueField
children.description: The value field for bubble layer symbols.The data item field should be a number.

children.name: layers.urlTemplate
Example - setting URL template for tile layer

children.description: The URL template for tile layers. Template variables:* x - X coordinate of the tile* y - Y coordinate of the tile* zoom - zoom level* subdomain - Subdomain for this tile. See [subdomains](#configuration-layers-tile-subdomains)

children.name: layers.style.stroke.width
Example - setting stroke width for shape layer

children.description: The default stroke width for layer shapes.

children.name: layers.style.stroke.opacity
Example - setting stroke opacity for shape layer

children.description: The default stroke opacity (0 to 1) for layer shapes.

children.name: layers.style.stroke.dashType
Example - setting stroke dash type for shape layer

children.description: The default dash type for layer shapes.The following dash types are supported:* "dash" - a line consisting of dashes* "dashDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of dash-dot* "dot" - a line consisting of dots* "longDash" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash* "longDashDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash-dot* "longDashDotDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash-dot-dot* "solid" - a solid line

children.name: layers.style.stroke.color
Example - setting stroke color for shape layer

children.description: The default stroke color for layer shapes.Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: layers.style.stroke
Example - setting stroke style for shape layer

children.description: The default stroke for layer shapes.Accepts a valid CSS color string or object with detailed configuration.

children.name: layers.style.fill.opacity
Example - setting fill opacity for shape layer

children.description: The default fill opacity (0 to 1) for layer shapes.

children.name: layers.style.fill.color
Example - setting fill color for shape layer

children.description: The default fill color for layer shapes.Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: layers.style.fill
children.description: The default fill for layer shapes.Accepts a valid CSS color string or object with detailed configuration.

children.name: layers.style
Example - setting style for shape layer

children.description: The default style for shapes.

children.name: layers.type
children.description: The layer type. Supported types are:* "bing" - a Bing (tm) tile layer* "tile" - a generic "slippy map" tile layer* "marker" - a data-bound marker layer* "shape" - a vector shape layer, e.g. bound to GeoJSON data* "bubble" - a specialized vector shape layer for bubble maps

children.name: layers.symbol
Example - Set symbol for bubble layer

children.description: The symbol to use for bubble layers. Possible values:* "circle" - A circle.* "square" - A square symbol.* function - An user defined symbol.The function must accept an object with the following fields:* center - The symbol center on the current layer.* size - The symbol size.* style - The symbol style.* dataItem - The dataItem used to create the symbol.* location - The location of the data point.The function return value must be a `kendo.drawing.Shape`.

children.name: layers.subdomains
Example - setting subdomains for OpenStreetMap tiles

children.description: A list of subdomains to use for loading tiles.Alternating between different subdomains allows more requests to be executed in parallel.

children.name: layers.opacity
children.description: The the opacity for the layer.

children.name: layers.minZoom
Example - switch to OpenCycleMap at zoom level 14

children.description: The minimum zoom level at which to show this layer.

children.name: layers.maxZoom
Example - switch to OpenCycleMap at zoom level 14

children.description: The maximum zoom level at which to show this layer.

children.name: layers.minSize
Example - Set minSize for bubble layer

children.description: The minimum symbol size for bubble layer symbols.> Setting non-zero value will distort symbol area to value ratio.

children.name: layers.maxSize
Example - Set minSize for bubble layer

children.description: The maximum symbol size for bubble layer symbols.

children.description: The event on which the tooltip will be shown. Predefined values are "mouseenter", "click" and "focus".

children.description: The position relative to the target element, at which the tooltip will be shown. Predefined values are "bottom", "top", "left", "right", "center".

children.description: The width (in pixels) of the tooltip.

children.description: The height (in pixels) of the tooltip.

If set to false, showAfter is specified and the showOn is set to "mouseenter" the Tooltip will be displayed after the given timeout even if the element is no longer hovered.

children.name: layers.tooltip
children.description: The default Kendo UI Tooltip options for data-bound markers.

children.name: layers.titleField
children.description: The data item field which contains the marker title.Requires the [dataSource](#configuration-layers-dataSource) option to be set.

children.name: layers.tileSize
children.description: The size of the image tile in pixels.

children.name: layers.shape
children.description: The default marker shape for data-bound markers. The following pre-defined marker shapes are available:* pinTarget* pinMarker shapes are implemented as CSS classes on the marker element (span.k-marker).For example "pinTarget" is rendered as "k-marker-pin-target".

children.name: layers.locationField
children.description: The data item field which contains the marker (symbol) location.The field should be an array with two numbers - latitude and longitude in decimal degrees.Requires the [dataSource](#configuration-layers-dataSource) option to be set.Only applicable to "marker" and "bubble" layers.

children.name: layers.culture
Example - set culture for bing layer

children.description: The culture to be used for the bing map tiles.

children.name: layers.imagerySet
children.description: The bing map tile types. Possible options:    * aerial - Aerial imagery.    * aerialWithLabels - Aerial imagery with a road overlay.    * birdseye - Bird’s eye (oblique-angle) imagery    * birdseyeWithLabels - Bird’s eye imagery with a road overlay.    * road - Roads without additional imagery. (default)

children.name: layers.key
children.description: The API key for the layer. Currently supported only for Bing (tm) tile layers.

children.name: layers.extent
Example - activate shape layer for given region

children.description: Specifies the extent of the region covered by this layer.The layer will be hidden when the specified area is out of view.Accepts a four-element array that specifies the extent covered by this layer:North-West lat, longitude, South-East latitude, longitude.If not specified, the layer is always visible.

children.name: layers.dataSource
Example - binding a marker layer to existing data source
Example - binding a shape layer to existing data source
Example - binding to inline GeoJSON data

children.description: The data source of the layer. Can be a JavaScript object which represents a valid data source configuration, a JavaScript array or an existing [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/framework/datasource)instance.

children.name: layers.autoBind
Example - set Bing (tm) layer API key

children.description: If set to `false` the layer will not bind to the data source during initialization. In this case data binding will occur when the [change](/api/framework/datasource#events-change) event of thedata source is fired. By default the widget will bind to the data source specified in the configuration.> Setting `autoBind` to `false` is useful when multiple layers (or widgets) are bound to the same data source. Disabling automatic binding ensures that the shared data source doesn't make more than one request to the remote service.

children.name: layers.attribution
children.description: The attribution for the layer. Accepts valid HTML.

children.name: layers
children.description: The configuration of the map layers.The layer type is determined by the value of the type field.

children.name: layerDefaults.bing.culture
Example - set default culture for bing layers

children.description: The culture to be used for the bing map tiles.

children.name: layerDefaults.bing.imagerySet
children.description: The bing map tile types. Possible options:    * aerial - Aerial imagery.    * aerialWithLabels - Aerial imagery with a road overlay.    * road - Roads without additional imagery. (default)

children.name: layerDefaults.bing.key
children.description: The key of all Bing (tm) tile layers.

children.name: layerDefaults.bing.opacity
Example - set Bing (tm) layer default opacity

children.description: The the opacity of all Bing (tm) tile layers.

children.name: layerDefaults.bing.attribution
Example - set default attribution for all Bing (tm) layers

children.description: The attribution of all Bing (tm) layers.

children.name: layerDefaults.bing
Example - set default options for all Bing (tm) layers

children.description: The default configuration for Bing (tm) tile layers.

children.name: layerDefaults.tile.opacity
Example - set tile layer default opacity

children.description: The the opacity of all tile layers.

children.name: layerDefaults.tile.subdomains
Example - set subdomains for all tile layers

children.description: The subdomain of all tile layers.

children.name: layerDefaults.tile.attribution
Example - set default attribution for all tile layers

children.description: The attribution of all tile layers.

children.name: layerDefaults.tile.urlTemplate
Example - set default URL template for all tile layers

children.description: The URL template for tile layers. Template variables:* x - X coordinate of the tile* y - Y coordinate of the tile* zoom - zoom level* subdomain - Subdomain for this tile. See [subdomains](#configuration-layers-tile-subdomains)

children.name: layerDefaults.tile
Example - set default options for all tile layers

children.description: The default configuration for tile layers.

children.name: layerDefaults.tileSize
children.description: The size of the image tile in pixels.

children.name: layerDefaults.bubble.symbol
Example - Set default symbol for all bubble layers

children.description: The default symbol for bubble layers. Possible values:* "circle" - A circle.* "square" - A square symbol.* function - An user defined symbol.The function must accept an object with the following fields:* center - The symbol center on the current layer.* size - The symbol size.* style - The symbol style.* dataItem - The dataItem used to create the symbol.* location - The location of the data point.The function return value must be a `kendo.drawing.Shape`.

children.name: layerDefaults.bubble.style.stroke.width
Example - Set default stroke width for all bubble layers

children.description: The default stroke width for bubble layer symbols.

children.name: layerDefaults.bubble.style.stroke.opacity
Example - Set default stroke with opacity for all bubble layers

children.description: The default stroke opacity (0 to 1) for bubble layer symbols.

children.name: layerDefaults.bubble.style.stroke.dashType
Example - Set default dashed stroke for all bubble layers

children.description: The default dash type for layer symbols.The following dash types are supported:* "dash" - a line consisting of dashes* "dashDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of dash-dot* "dot" - a line consisting of dots* "longDash" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash* "longDashDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash-dot* "longDashDotDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash-dot-dot* "solid" - a solid line

children.description: The default stroke color for bubble layer symbols.Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.opacity
Example - set marker layer default opacity

children.description: The the opacity of all marker layers.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.showOn
Example - show tooltip on mouse enter

children.description: The event on which the tooltip will be shown. Predefined values are "mouseenter", "click" and "focus".

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.showAfter
children.description: Specify the delay in milliseconds before the tooltip is shown. This option is ignored if showOn is set to "click" or "focus".

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.position
children.description: The position relative to the target element, at which the tooltip will be shown. Predefined values are "bottom", "top", "left", "right", "center".

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.width
Example - set the width of the tooltip

children.description: The width (in pixels) of the tooltip.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.height
Example - set the height of the tooltip

children.description: The height (in pixels) of the tooltip.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.iframe
Example - load content from remote URL

children.description: Explicitly states whether content iframe should be created.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.callout
children.description: Specifies if the tooltip callout will be displayed.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.template
Example - use formatted dataItem value in the tooltip template

children.description: The [template](/api/framework/kendo#methods-template) which renders the tooltip content.The fields which can be used in the template are:* location - the marker location (`kendo.dataviz.map.Location` instance)* marker - the marker instance> Setting a template disables the content option.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.content.url
Example - load content from remote URL

children.description: Specifies a URL or request options that the tooltip should load its content from.>Note: For URLs starting with a protocol (e.g. http://),a container iframe element is automatically created. This behavior may change in futureversions, so it is advisable to always use the [iframe configuration option](#iframe).

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.content
Example - extract the content from target marker

children.description: The text or a function which result will be shown within the tooltip.By default the tooltip will display the target element title attribute content.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.animation.open.duration
children.description: Defines the animation duration.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.animation.open.effects
children.description: Effect to be used for opening of the Tooltip.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.animation.open
children.description: The animation that will be used when a Tooltip opens.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.animation.close.duration
children.description: Defines the animation duration.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.animation.close.effects
children.description: Effect to be used for closing of the tooltip.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.animation.close
children.description: The animation that will be used when a Tooltip closes.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.animation
children.description: A collection of {Animation} objects, used to change default animations. A value of **false**will disable all animations in the widget.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip.autoHide
Example - hide tooltip on mouse leave

children.description: Specifies if the tooltip will be hidden when mouse leaves the target element. If set to false a close button will be shown within tooltip. If set to false, showAfter is specified and the showOn is set to "mouseenter" the Tooltip will be displayed after the given timeout even if the element is no longer hovered.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.tooltip
children.description: The default Kendo UI Tooltip options for all marker layers.

children.name: layerDefaults.marker.shape
children.description: The default marker shape for all marker layers. The following pre-defined marker shapes are available:* pinTarget* pinMarker shapes are implemented as CSS classes on the marker element (span.k-marker).For example "pinTarget" is rendered as "k-marker-pin-target".

children.name: layerDefaults.marker
children.description: The default configuration for marker layers.

children.name: layerDefaults
children.description: The default configuration for map layers by type.

children.name: controls.zoom.position
children.description: The position of the zoom control. Possible values include:* "topLeft"* "topRight"* "bottomRight"* "bottomLeft"

children.name: controls.zoom
children.description: Configures or disables the built-in zoom control (+/- button).

children.name: controls.navigator.position
children.description: The position of the navigator control. Possible values include:* "topLeft"* "topRight"* "bottomRight"* "bottomLeft"

children.name: controls.navigator
children.description: Configures or disables the built-in navigator control (directional pad).

children.name: controls.attribution.position
children.description: The position of the attribution control. Possible values include:* "topLeft"* "topRight"* "bottomRight"* "bottomLeft"

children.name: controls.attribution
children.description: Configures or disables the built-in attribution control.

children.name: controls
children.description: The configuration of built-in map controls.

children.name: center
children.description: The map center. Coordinates are listed as `[Latitude, Longitude]`.
